intro: Droguetia leptostachys, commonly known as the slender-stemmed droguetia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, red berries as fruits. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
